pe_description: The Retailing sub-sector in Indonesia exhibits a P/E ratio of 15.46, exceeding the average IDX P/E ratio. This year's P/E ratio underperforms compared to last year's data, ranking 25th among other sub-sectors in the Indonesian market. Out of the companies in this sub-sector, eight outperform the average P/E ratio. '###Matahari Department Store Tbk####', '###PT Gaya Abadi Sempurna Tbk####', and '###PT Mitra Pinasthika Mustika Tbk.####' are considered undervalued based on their P/E ratios, while '###PT Bersama Zatta Jaya Tbk####' is overvalued and should be avoided. Factors influencing growth within the Retailing sub-sector include e-commerce penetration, consumer spending patterns, and the overall economic climate.
health_description: The Retailing sub-sector in Indonesia, comprising 30 companies, ranks 19th in terms of price changes over the past 30 days, with an average price change below the IDX average. The sub-sector has not seen any new listings this month, with the last one occurring on 2023-09-07, indicating potential barriers to entry. Out of the 30 companies, only 8 experienced positive price changes in the last 30 days. Factors that can affect the Retailing market health index include consumer spending patterns, e-commerce competition, government regulations, and supply chain disruptions. The Indonesian government body responsible for making regulations that can impact the resilience of the Retailing sub-sector is the Ministry of Trade.
growth_description: The Retailing sub-sector in Indonesia experienced a decline in earnings and a rise in revenue in the past year. The sub-sector ranked 23rd in terms of earnings growth and 8th in terms of revenue growth compared to other sub-sectors. ###PT Autopedia Sukses Lestari Tbk####, ###Sona Topas Tourism Industry Tbk####, and ###Ramayana Lestari Sentosa Tbk#### were the top-performing companies in terms of earnings growth, revenue growth, and net profit margin, respectively. Conditions that could affect the Retailing sub-sector's growth include changes in consumer spending patterns, the rise of e-commerce, and government regulations specifically targeting the retail industry.
